intro: Phacelia dubia var. fallax, commonly known as the fallax phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces, and its flowers bloom in early to mid-summer. This variety is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
